page.title: 12Transport.Local.
page.content: The town is situated on the old coaching route between two neighbouring cities.The Red Lion was famous as a coaching inn and the old stables have been converted into a restuarant. One of the earliest railways went through the town,long before Portsmouth had a railway.This was to enable Queen Victoria to travel from London to Gosport where she embarked on a boat to the Isle of Wight and her beloved Osborne.Nowadays the ferries run from Portsmouth to the Isle of Wight for both foot passengers and seperate car ferries. It takes one hour and forty minutes from Fareham to Waterloo by British Rail.
